newsitem.title: ITALY: PRESS DIGEST - Italy - Tuesday Oct 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Italy - Tuesday Oct 1.

text.p: Following are some of the top headlines in leading Italian newspapers.

* Finance minister Vincenzo Visco said some European partners are trying to keep Italy out of EMU. Spanish Prime minister in an interview said Italy was looking to Spain for support in a tentative bid to persuade European partners to relax tight Maastricht criteria, but Aznar refused. French President Jacques Chirac was quoted as saying an undervalued lira is harming the French industry (all).
* Trade unions demand changes to the government 1997 budget and say they will stage a national street demonstation if their requests are not accepted.(Corriere della Sera, Repubblica)

* Olivetti net group debt nearly doubled in July and August to 2.39 trillion lire. Police searched the headquarters of Cofide group holding in an inquiry over the bankrupt of another company, Sasea, which had links with Cofide (all).

*In the first Treasury auction after the presentation of the budget, three and five year fixed-rate Btp bonds yield fell sharply to a fresh low since January 1994. Traders now await a cut in interest rate from Bank of Italia, but Governor Antonio Fazio insists inflation must come down to 3 pct before. (Corriere, Sole 24 Ore).
* Giorgio Fossa, chairman of Italy's employers association, says the economy needs more structural cuts in public spending and is worried a tough recession might hit Italy's in 1997 (Sole).
Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
